references.paper_title: Kernelized Multiplicative Weights for 0/1-Polyhedral Games: Bridging the Gap Between Learning in Extensive-Form and Normal-Form Games
references.reason: This paper introduces a novel algorithm, KOMWU, that achieves state-of-the-art performance in solving extensive-form games and is closely related to the DilEnt regularizer studied in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Faster Algorithms for Extensive-Form Game Solving via Improved Smoothing Functions
references.reason: This paper provides strong convexity bounds for dilated entropy, a key component for analyzing the optimality of the DilEnt regularizer discussed in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Efficient Φ-Regret Minimization in Extensive-Form Games via Online Mirror Descent
references.reason: This paper establishes a connection between online mirror descent and KOMWU, which is crucial for understanding the relationship between OMD and DilEnt.

references.paper_title: Near-Optimal No-Regret Learning in General Games
references.reason: This paper provides a near-optimal regret bound for online learning in general games, which serves as a benchmark for evaluating the performance of DilEnt.
This paper provides a regret bound for online mirror descent (OMD), a fundamental algorithm used for solving extensive-form games and closely related to the analysis in the main paper.
